newsitem.title: USA: Norfolk CEO salary, bonus rises in 1996.
newsitem.headline: Norfolk CEO salary, bonus rises in 1996.

text.p: Norfolk Southern Corp paid David Goode, chairman and chief executive officer, a salary of $800,000 for 1996, 16.8 percent more than 1995, and a bonus of $800,000, up nearly 30 percent, a regulatory filing said.

In a proxy filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission Tuesday, the railroad said the increase in salary reflected the corporation's overall performance in 1995, including its total operating revenues and record net income.
For 1996, Norfolk granted Goode options on 40,000 shares of common stock and the opportunity to earn up to 25,000 performance shares, the proxy said.

Performance shares awarded in 1996, when earned out, will be issued one half in cash and one half in stock, with the stock portion being held by the corporation for up to 60 months unless waived by the compensation committee.
